A very fun game to play with a few friends. I convinced a few friends to get this over the Christmas break and we had a blast. We now have weekly Killing Floor sessions and it just never gets dull.
The huge amount of maps keeps things fresh and the strong british accents / humour do keep the mood very light whilst you ruin some walls with Zed bits.

This is a very fun group game. Yes it is old but they keep adding maps and content to it. Have four or five other friends over and have a blast.  The Zed time take a little bit to adjust to but you will soon use it to your advantage :D

Killing Floor has some solid gameplay. The classes are interesting and different enough that varied styles of gameplay will find a niche within the game. The AI of the enemies is also done well enough that you stay on your toes during the entire round of play. There are also a number of maps that have been designed differently enough as to have preferences. 

The two main problems with Killing Floor are the fact that it has little storyline. There is no first person campaign. There are a few maps which are objective based which have an NPC guiding you through the level and these are interesting enough that I would like more of them as right now there isnt enough.

The other problem (and a major issue) is the fact that trying to make games which you and your friends can join together is a tremendous pain and not fully worked out. In many ways it's much easier to find a game on the internet both of you can join rather than making your own. This is a major problem which lots of people have complained about on different forums for the game and one which needs to be resolved. 

As mentioned earlier the gameplay is solid, but it can also get old. It is very easy to get surrounded in the game and consequently some can be easily frustrated by dieing a lot or by not completing entire levels. A problem with playing in many different internet games is that most players seem to ignore the intended role of their classes and consequently the team fails as a result. As there is never an explanation of what role each class was supposed to play, the players are left up to themselves to read the meta on the game and find out (which in some ways, is asking a lot of players). Others may eventually find the gameplay to eventually become boring as there is hardly any depth to the game. Even though whats there is fun, it essentially boils down to just killing hordes of undead.

Also, many of the funnest guns are not part of the initial offering price and come in the form of extra downloadable content which costs more money. While the DLC is not necessary, it is fun. 

I can recommend the game because it is fun (kind of like Counter Strike with hordes of zombies) but buying it on sale seems the smartest thing to me. Especially if you're going to buy the DLC content with it.

Killing Floor, oh Killing Floor. Eines der besten Zombie-Survival-Spiele, welche ich je spielen durfte. Als Anfänger kann man es wohl kaum glauben, dass einem das Spiel so lange so viel Spaß bereiten kann. Das Gameplay ist sehr gut. Teamwork ist ab Stufe "Schwer" sehr wichtig d.H, dass ohne einen Medic fast nichts mehr geht. Es gibt viele Klassen, welche man hochspielen kann, um vorteile für Waffen der dazugehörigen Klasse zu bekommen. Von schneller Nachladen, mehr Schaden bis hin zum Rabatt beim Händler. Die Waffen gefallen mir alle soweit ganz gut, obwohl es mich ein bisschen nervt, dass das Spiel mit DLC's erschlagen wird, aber die Entwickler wollen selbstverständlich auch Geld verdienen. Das Spiel wird dadurch auch abwechslungsreicher. Alles in allem ist Killing Floor ein Super Zombie-Survival-Spiel, welches mir über 140 Stunden spaß bereitet hat, ob alleine oder mit Freunden. Sogar nach  170 Stunden, starte ich es das ein oder andere mal, um den bösen Zombies zu zeigen wer hier der Chef ist. 

Grafik 6/10
Gameplay 8/10
Teamwork 8/10
Langzeit Motivation: 7/0
Abwechslungsmöglichkeiten: 7/10
